column4: is there a safety mode for dd?  I don't want to accidentally erase my computer
i'm trying to do this: sudo dd if=/dev/sdb of=/home/me/sansa/file1
will that command pose any danger?
might not be as useful as you think; would be dangerous if /home/me is on sdb
what are you *really* trying to do?
and you have enough space there?
i'm working with #rockbox to unbrick my sansa, i'm just unfamiliar with dd
yes, sda5 has oodles of free space, sdb1 is 30 mb
oic ... yeah, that's no problem; i'd also do bs=2048 fwiw
best advice i can give is to triple check if= and of= before hitting enter!
did you get that last message? what does the block size command do?
bs= "blocksize" ... i.e. how many bytes to read before writing ...
and why is it good to specify?
variety of reasons; probably not necessary; might speed things up a bit
If I wanted to see if the two dd'd files were the same, would I take the md5sum?
if I wanted to see if those two dd'd files were the same, would I take the md5sum -b of both?
